recipes.name: Pasta with Mushrooms and Cream (Pasta ai Funghi e Panna)
steps: Heat olive oil in a pan. Add chopped garlic and sliced leeks, sauté until soft.
Add mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown.
Add a crumbled chicken bouillon cube and stir.
Pour in heavy cream and cook over low heat to form a creamy sauce.
Partially cook lasagna sheets in boiling water, then drain them slightly undercooked.
Add the lasagna sheets to the pan with the mushroom sauce and finish cooking gently over low heat.
Add fresh tarragon, stir well, and serve.
author: Marco Mamprin
notes: A creamy and flavorful dish perfect for mushroom lovers.
wine: Pair with a Chardonnay or Pinot Noir.
nutritional_infos: Calories: 450 per serving, Protein: 12g, Fat: 25g, Carbs: 40g

recipes.name: Farfalle with Ricotta, Pancetta, and Peas (Farfalle con Ricotta, Pancetta e Piselli)
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add farfalle pasta.
A few minutes before the pasta is ready, add peas to the boiling water.
Meanwhile, in a pan, sauté pancetta and garlic until pancetta is crisp.
Drain pasta and peas, reserving a little cooking water.
Mix pasta and peas with pancetta, adding crème fraîche and ricotta cheese.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
If needed, loosen the sauce with a bit of reserved pasta water. Serve warm.
author: Marco Mamprin
notes: A creamy and savory pasta dish with a hint of sweetness from peas.
nutritional_infos: Calories: 400 per serving, Protein: 15g, Fat: 20g, Carbs: 35g

recipes.name: Tagliatelle with Sausage and Cherry Tomatoes (Tagliatelle con Salsiccia e Pomodorini)
steps: In a large pan, heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion and garlic until translucent.
Add crumbled sausage and cook until browned.
Add halved cherry tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Boil tagliatelle in salted water until al dente.
Reserve some pasta water, then drain the tagliatelle.
Toss the tagliatelle into the pan with the sausage and tomatoes, adding some pasta water to make a light sauce.
Sprinkle generously with grated Parmesan cheese before serving.
author: Marco Mamprin
notes: A hearty pasta dish with a rich tomato and sausage flavor.
wine: Pair with a Chianti or Sangiovese.
nutritional_infos: Calories: 500 per serving, Protein: 20g, Fat: 25g, Carbs: 50g

recipes.name: Spaghetti with Sardines, Chili and Breadcrumbs (Spaghetti con Sarde, Peperoncino e Pangrattato)
ingredients: 100 gr sardines (drained and broken into small pieces)
steps: In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté garlic. Add breadcrumbs and toast them until golden. Set aside on kitchen paper to drain.
In the same pan, add more olive oil if needed and sauté garlic and chili pepper until fragrant.
Add the sardines and cook briefly, breaking them into smaller pieces.
Season with salt, pepper, and oregano.
Boil spaghetti until al dente, then drain and toss with the sardine sauce.
Top with arugula and the toasted breadcrumbs before serving.
author: Marco Mamprin
notes: A bold and flavorful dish with a spicy kick.
wine: Pair with a dry white wine like Vermentino.
nutritional_infos: Calories: 350 per serving, Protein: 18g, Fat: 12g, Carbs: 40g
